title: Saudi coalition 'launches attacks on Yemeni military targets' in first operation since oil facilities attack
text:
The Saudi-led military coalition has reportedly carried out attacks on targets in Yemen - the first response since an assault on oil facilities that the US has blamed on Iran.

Six days after Saudi oil facilities at Khurai and Abqaiq were attacked and damaged, an operation Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for and which temporarily halved the kingdom’s oil production, state television said there had been a military strike north of Yemen’s port city of Hodeidah.

State-run Ekhbariya TV said on Friday morning local time, the coalition, which has the support of both the US and the UK, had struck “legitimate military targets”.

There was no immediate confirmation of the strikes, or which coalition members were involved. The broadcast on state television urged civilians to stay away from the areas that had been hit.

The reported operation came a day after officials in Saudi Arabia held a press conference to display debris from drones and cruise missiles that proved Iran was involved in the strike. Iran has repeatedly denied it was involved and has vowed to defend itself.
